org.apache.drill.common.logical

Interface FormatPluginConfig

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AvroFormatConfig, ExcelFormatConfig, FormatPluginConfigBase, HttpdLogFormatConfig, ImageFormatConfig, JSONFormatPlugin.JSONFormatConfig, LogFormatConfig, LTSVFormatPluginConfig, MapRDBFormatPluginConfig, NamedFormatPluginConfig, ParquetFormatConfig, PcapFormatConfig, PcapngFormatConfig, SequenceFileFormatConfig, ShpFormatConfig, StreamsFormatPluginConfig, SyslogFormatConfig, TableFormatPluginConfig, TextFormatPlugin.TextFormatConfig

    public interface FormatPluginConfig
    Interface for defining a Drill format plugin. Format plugins are contained within storage plugins to describe particular data formats available in a given storage system. These formats are not necessarily tied to how the data is stored. One current use of this abstraction is describing different file formats like CSV and JSON that can be stored in a filesystem. Some storage systems like databases may only have a single format in which the data is actually stored. This interface enables flexibility for configuring the different data formats that will live under one storage system. The storage systems themselves are described in StoragePluginConfigs.

      static org.slf4j.Logger logger 

    • Field Detail

      • logger

        static final org.slf4j.Logger logger
